### [scripts.js](file:///c%3A/Users/alpya/Documents/GitHub/AlpWebsite/scripts.js)

Refine the language switching logic to better preserve potential HTML tags within translatable elements.

````javascript
// ...existing code...

    const setLanguage = (lang) => {
        if (lang !== 'en' && lang !== 'tr') lang = 'en'; // Default

        // Update text content more safely
        translatableElements.forEach(el => {
            const text = el.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}`);
            if (text !== null) {
                // Check if the element contains only text or specific allowed tags (like <i>)
                const hasNonTextChildren = Array.from(el.childNodes).some(node =>
                    node.nodeType === Node.ELEMENT_NODE && node.tagName.toLowerCase() !== 'i'
                );

                if (!hasNonTextChildren && el.firstElementChild && el.firstElementChild.tagName.toLowerCase() === 'i') {
                    // Handle case with leading icon (like in collapsible headers)
                    const iconHTML = el.firstElementChild.outerHTML;
                    // Use textContent for the rest to avoid parsing issues if data attribute contains HTML
                    const textContentOnly = text.replace(/<i.*?><\/i>\s*/i, '').trim();
                    el.innerHTML = iconHTML + ' '; // Add space after icon
                    // Append the text as a text node
                    el.appendChild(document.createTextNode(textContentOnly));
                } else {
                    // For simple text or elements where we don't want to preserve complex inner HTML,
                    // set textContent directly. This is safer than innerHTML if 'text' might contain unwanted HTML.
                    el.textContent = text;
                }
            }
        });

        // Update HTML lang attribute
        htmlTag.setAttribute('lang', lang);

        // Update Title tag
        if (titleTag) {
             const titleText = titleTag.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}`);
             if (titleText) {
                titleTag.textContent = titleText;
             }
        }

        // Update button active states in all switchers
        langSwitchContainers.forEach(container => {
            container.querySelectorAll('button[data-lang]').forEach(btn => {
                if (btn.getAttribute('data-lang') === lang) {
                    btn.classList.add('active');
                } else {
                    btn.classList.remove('active');
                }
            });
        });

        // Store preference
        try {
            localStorage.setItem('preferredLanguage', lang);
        } catch (e) {
            console.warn("Could not save language preference to localStorage:", e);
        }
    };

    // Add event listeners to all language buttons
// ...existing code...
```

### c:\Users\alpya\Documents\GitHub\AlpWebsite\sitemap.xml

````xml

<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9">
  <url>
    <loc>https://alpyalay.org/</loc>
    <!-- Update this date to the actual last modification date -->
    <lastmod>2024-08-01</lastmod>
    <changefreq>monthly</changefreq>
    <priority>1.0</priority>
  </url>
</urlset>
````

**Additional Recommendations (No Code Changes):**

1.  **Content:**
    *   **Value Proposition:** In the "About Me" section, clearly articulate the unique value you bring to clients (e.g., "Bridging the gap between complex technical concepts and clear Turkish localization for maximum player engagement").
    *   **Results-Oriented Descriptions:** For projects and translations, try to quantify achievements or highlight specific positive outcomes where possible (e.g., "Contributed to a successful launch in the Turkish market," "Developed a tool that reduced comparison time by X%").
    *   **Testimonials:** Actively seek and add testimonials from clients or collaborators if possible. This adds significant credibility.
    *   **Case Studies:** Consider selecting 1-2 key projects (like *Battle Talent*) and expanding their description into a mini-case study: outline the challenge, your process/solution, and the results/impact.
2.  **Audits:**
    *   **Accessibility:** Run tools like Lighthouse in Chrome DevTools or the WAVE browser extension to catch potential accessibility issues (e.g., color contrast, ARIA roles). Test keyboard navigation thoroughly.
    *   **Performance:** Use Lighthouse or WebPageTest to identify further performance bottlenecks (e.g., image compression, unused CSS/JS).
3.  **Visuals:**
    *   Ensure all images are crisp and load quickly. The placeholder fallbacks are basic; consider if more informative fallbacks are needed or if the `onerror` could attempt to load a different format (e.g., `.jpg` if `.webp` fails, though this adds complexity).

### [battle-talent-case-study.html](file:///c%3A/Users/alpya/Documents/GitHub/AlpWebsite/CaseStudyPage/battle-talent-case-study.html)

Create the HTML structure for the case study page, incorporating the text content.

````html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta name="description" content="Case study detailing the Turkish localization of the VR game Battle Talent by Alp Yalay.">
    <title>Case Study: Battle Talent Turkish Localization | Alp Yalay</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="case-study.css">
    <!-- Preload Font Awesome CSS -->
    <link rel="preload" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.4.0/css/all.min.css" as="style" integrity="sha512-iecdLmaskl7CVkqkXNQ/ZH/XLlvWZOJyj7Yy7tcenmpD1ypASozpmT/E0iPtmFIB46ZmdtAc9eNBvH0H/ZpiBw==" crossorigin="anonymous" referrerpolicy="no-referrer" onload="this.onload=null;this.rel='stylesheet'" />
    <noscript><link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.4.0/css/all.min.css" integrity="sha512-iecdLmaskl7CVkqkXNQ/ZH/XLlvWZOJyj7Yy7tcenmpD1ypASozpmT/E0iPtmFIB46ZmdtAc9eNBvH0H/ZpiBw==" crossorigin="anonymous" referrerpolicy="no-referrer" /></noscript>
    <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="../Assets/alplogo.webp">
</head>
<body>
    <header class="case-study-header">
        <div class="container">
            <a href="../index.html#translations" class="back-link"><i class="fas fa-arrow-left"></i> Back to Portfolio</a>
            <h1>Case Study: Bringing Battle Talent VR to Turkish Players</h1>
        </div>
    </header>

    <main class="case-study-content">
        <div class="container">
            <section class="project-overview">
                <h2>Project Overview</h2>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong>Project:</strong> Turkish Localization of Battle Talent</li>
                    <li><strong>Client:</strong> CyDream Technologies Limited</li>
                    <li><strong>Platform:</strong> Steam VR, Meta Quest</li>
                    <li><strong>Timeline:</strong> January 2021 - Present (Ongoing)</li>
                    <li><strong>Volume:</strong> Approx. 14,700 words / 86,000 characters (as of April 2025)</li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2>Introduction</h2>
                <p>This case study details the ongoing Turkish localization project for Battle Talent, a physics-based VR rogue-lite action game developed by CyDream Technologies. Undertaken initially as a personal challenge while completing university studies in Translation & Interpretation, this project served as a crucial first step into the world of professional game localization, demanding adaptability, resourcefulness, and a long-term commitment.</p>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2>The Challenge: Navigating Early Career Localization Hurdles</h2>
                <p>The primary objective was to proactively seek practical game localization experience, applying academic knowledge to a real-world project and demonstrating capability in the field. However, this ambition came with several significant hurdles:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong>Indirect Source Text:</strong> The English text used as the source for Turkish translation was itself a non-professional translation from the original Simplified Chinese, introducing a layer of potential ambiguity and requiring careful interpretation.</li>
                    <li><strong>Tooling & Workflow Constraints:</strong> The localization process relied entirely on a shared Google Sheet for all translators across different languages. This lacked the robust features of standard CAT tools, making terminology management and consistency tracking difficult, especially in the early stages.</li>
                    <li><strong>Terminology & Consistency:</strong> Establishing appropriate Turkish terminology for unique game concepts (e.g., weapon types like 'Rapier', spell names like 'Abyssal Faith Spell') was challenging due to the lack of established Turkish gaming glossaries or accessible translation memories. Ensuring consistency across the growing text volume (~14.7k words) within the Google Sheet environment required meticulous effort.</li>
                    <li><strong>Limited Testing Environment:</strong> No dedicated developer build was available for testing. Validating translations required waiting for monthly public game updates and then testing playthroughs within the live VR environment – a physically demanding and time-consuming process for a game with a relatively small Turkish player base, limiting feedback opportunities.</li>
                    <li><strong>Lack of Formal Guidance:</strong> While the developers were supportive, no formal style guide or glossary was provided initially, requiring proactive establishment of localization standards for Turkish.</li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2>Process & Solution: Adaptability and Continuous Improvement</h2>
                <p>Despite the constraints, a pragmatic and evolving workflow was established:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong>Research-Driven Translation:</strong> Each term or string was approached with research, utilizing online dictionaries (Tureng.com), cross-referencing translations in other Turkish-localized games, and occasionally leveraging AI for obscure terms. Translations were entered directly into the shared Google Sheet.</li>
                    <li><strong>Personal Glossary Development:</strong> A personal glossary was created and maintained to track key terms and ensure consistency, with plans to develop a dedicated terminology management app.</li>
                    <li><strong>Post-Update LQA:</strong> Following each monthly game update, dedicated time was spent testing the newly added or modified Turkish strings within the VR game itself, identifying and correcting errors or awkward phrasing (post-editing).</li>
                    <li><strong>Leveraging AI for Consistency:</strong> To address the consistency challenges inherent in the spreadsheet-based workflow, a 'Hybrid Translation Methodology' was adopted as Large Language Models became more capable (specifically Gemini 2.5 Pro as of April 2025). The entire translation text was periodically fed into the AI, which helped identify potential inconsistencies (e.g., flagging similar source terms translated differently, variations in standard UI phrasing) that were difficult to spot manually in the spreadsheet format, allowing for targeted rectification.</li>
                    <li><strong>Community & Developer Communication:</strong> Active participation in the dedicated translator Discord channel facilitated communication with other language translators and the development team for clarifications, bug reporting, and feedback.</li>
                    <li><strong>Iterative Refinement:</strong> Recognizing the learning curve, older translations were revisited and updated over the years to reflect improved skills, better terminology choices, and a deeper understanding of localization best practices.</li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2>Results & Impact: Delivering Value and Fostering Growth</h2>
                <p>The ongoing localization effort has successfully made Battle Talent accessible to its Turkish-speaking audience and yielded significant personal development:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong>Enhanced Accessibility for Turkish Players:</strong> Delivered and maintained a complete Turkish localization, making the VR experience fully accessible and enjoyable for the Turkish-speaking player base. Developer data indicated approximately 84 players were engaging with the game in or near Turkey. While direct feedback was scarce, 5 Steam reviews were posted in Turkish.</li>
                    <li><strong>Strong Developer Relationship:</strong> Trust was established and maintained with CyDream Technologies, who relied on this sole effort for the Turkish market. Communication remained open and positive via Discord.</li>
                    <li><strong>Solidified Career Path:</strong> The project confirmed a passion for game localization and highlighted the need for quality localization in the Turkish market, noting a lack of resources for aspiring localizers.</li>
                    <li><strong>Demonstrated Resilience & Adaptability:</strong> Successfully navigating the project's constraints (indirect source text, basic tools, limited testing) showcased problem-solving skills and commitment.</li>
                    <li><strong>Foundation for Future Projects:</strong> The experience gained provided the confidence and skillset to take on larger, more complex localization projects, such as Heroes of Hammerwatch II. It underscored the importance of devotion to long-term projects involving continuous updates.</li>
                    <li><strong>Skill Development:</strong> The project honed skills in technical translation, terminology management, LQA in VR, post-editing, cross-cultural communication (within the translation team), and integrating AI tools effectively into the workflow.</li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2>Conclusion</h2>
                <p>The Battle Talent Turkish localization project stands as a testament to proactive learning and dedication. Overcoming initial challenges related to resources, tools, and testing methodology, this ongoing effort not only delivered a valuable localization for Turkish VR gamers but also provided an invaluable foundation, shaping a dedicated approach to game localization characterized by continuous improvement, adaptability, and a commitment to quality.</p>
            </section>
        </div>
    </main>

    <footer class="case-study-footer">
        <div class="container">
            <p>&copy; 2024 Alp Yalay. <a href="../index.html">Return to main portfolio</a>.</p>
        </div>
    </footer>

    <script src="case-study.js"></script>
</body>
</html>
````

````css
/* Basic Styles for Case Study Page */

:root {
    /* Reusing some colors from main site for consistency */
    --primary-color: #156129;
    --accent-color: #1a7fbc;
    --background-color: #020912ff;
    --background-alt-color: #0c1726;
    --card-bg-color: #112233;

    --text-secondary-color: #ced4da;
    --border-color: #31543fff;

    /* Spacing */
    --space-md: 1rem;
    --space-lg: 1.5rem;
    --space-xl: 2.5rem;
    --space-xxl: 4rem;
}

body {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
    line-height: 1.7;
    color: var(--text-secondary-color);
    background-color: var(--background-color);
    font-size: 16px;
}

    width: 90%;
    max-width: 900px; /* Slightly narrower for readability */
    margin: 0 auto;
    padding-left: var(--space-md);
    padding-right: var(--space-md);
}

/* Header */
.case-study-header {
    background-color: var(--background-alt-color);
    padding: var(--space-lg) 0;
    border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-color);
    margin-bottom: var(--space-xl);
}

    font-size: 2.5rem;
    margin: var(--space-md) 0 0 0;
    line-height: 1.2;
}

.back-link {
    display: inline-block;
    color: var(--primary-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    margin-bottom: var(--space-md);
    font-size: 0.9rem;
    transition: color 0.2s ease;
}

.back-link:hover {
    color: var(--accent-color);
}

.back-link i {
    margin-right: 0.5em;
}

/* Main Content */
.case-study-content section {
    margin-bottom: var(--space-xl);
    padding: var(--space-lg);
    background-color: var(--card-bg-color);
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 1px solid var(--border-color);
    box-shadow: 0 3px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
}

.case-study-content h2 {
    color: var(--accent-color);
    font-family: 'Funnel Display', sans-serif;

    display: inline-block;
}

    margin-bottom: var(--space-md);
}

    padding-left: var(--space-md);
}

    margin-bottom: var(--space-md);
}

.case-study-content strong {
    color: var(--text-primary-color);
    font-weight: 600;
}

/* Footer */
.case-study-footer {
    background-color: var(--background-alt-color);
    padding: var(--space-lg) 0;
    margin-top: var(--space-xxl);

    color: var(--text-secondary-color);

    color: var(--primary-color);
    text-decoration: none;
}

    text-decoration: underline;
}

/* Responsive */

        font-size: 2rem;

                            </p>
                            <p data-lang-en="My professional experience includes an internship at Şafak Tercüme, providing exposure to translation agency workflows, and a role as Junior Social Media Manager at Muse İstanbul, where responsibilities included content translation and creative writing. These experiences have provided practical familiarity with localization processes for technical and marketing content." data-lang-tr="Mesleki deneyimim, çeviri ajansı iş akışlarına aşinalık sağlayan Şafak Tercüme'deki stajımı ve içerik çevirisi ile yaratıcı yazarlık gibi sorumlulukları içeren Muse İstanbul'daki Junior Sosyal Medya Yöneticiliği rolünü kapsamaktadır. Bu deneyimler, teknik ve pazarlama içeriklerine yönelik yerelleştirme süreçlerinde pratik bilgi sağlamıştır.">
                            </p>
<!-- ...existing code... -->
                    <div class="collapsible-content" id="education-content" hidden>
                        <div class="experience-list">
                            <div class="experience-item education-entry">
                                <h3 data-lang-en="<i class='fas fa-university'></i> Bachelor's Degree in Translation and Interpreting" data-lang-tr="<i class='fas fa-university'></i> Mütercim-Tercümanlık Lisans Derecesi"><i class="fas fa-university"></i> Bachelor's Degree in Translation and Interpreting</h3>
                                <h4 data-lang-en="Izmir University of Economics" data-lang-tr="İzmir Ekonomi Üniversitesi">Izmir University of Economics</h4>
                                <p class="experience-date" data-lang-en="Sep 2018 - Jun 2022 | Izmir, Turkey" data-lang-tr="Eyl 2018 - Haz 2022 | İzmir, Türkiye">Sep 2018 - Jun 2022 | Izmir, Turkey</p>
                                <p data-lang-en="Specialized in Economic Translation, Legal Translation & Transcreation. Learned SDL Trados & SmartCat, participated in Photographic Activities. GPA: 2.86, Last Semester: 3.45" data-lang-tr="Ekonomi Çevirisi, Hukuk Çevirisi ve Yaratıcı Çeviri alanlarında uzmanlaştım. SDL Trados ve SmartCat öğrendim, Fotoğrafçılık Aktivitelerine katıldım. GPA: 2.86, Son Dönem: 3.45">Specialized in Economic Translation, Legal Translation & Transcreation. Learned SDL Trados & SmartCat, participated in Photographic Activities. GPA: 2.86, Last Semester: 3.45</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="experience-item education-entry">
<!-- ...existing code... -->
````

### [battle-talent-case-study.html](file:///c%3A/Users/alpya/Documents/GitHub/AlpWebsite/CaseStudyPage/battle-talent-case-study.html)

Add language switcher, translate content using data attributes, and add attributes to the floating button.

````html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en"> <!-- Set initial lang -->
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta name="description" data-lang-en="Case study detailing the Turkish localization of the VR game Battle Talent by Alp Yalay." data-lang-tr="Alp Yalay tarafından VR oyunu Battle Talent'ın Türkçe yerelleştirmesini detaylandıran vaka çalışması.">
    <title data-lang-en="Case Study: Battle Talent Turkish Localization | Alp Yalay" data-lang-tr="Vaka Çalışması: Battle Talent Türkçe Yerelleştirme | Alp Yalay">Case Study: Battle Talent Turkish Localization | Alp Yalay</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="case-study.css">
    <!-- Preload Font Awesome CSS -->

    <noscript><link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.4.0/css/all.min.css" integrity="sha512-iecdLmaskl7CVkqkXNQ/ZH/XLlvWZOJyj7Yy7tcenmpD1ypASozpmT/E0iPtmFIB46ZmdtAc9eNBvH0H/ZpiBw==" crossorigin="anonymous" referrerpolicy="no-referrer" /></noscript>
    <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="../Assets/alplogo.webp">
</head>
<body>
    <header class="case-study-header">
        <div class="container">
             <div class="header-top">
                <a href="../index.html#translations" class="back-link" data-lang-en="<i class='fas fa-arrow-left'></i> Back to Portfolio" data-lang-tr="<i class='fas fa-arrow-left'></i> Portfolyoya Dön"><i class="fas fa-arrow-left"></i> Back to Portfolio</a>
                <!-- Language Switcher -->
                <div class="lang-switch" id="case-study-lang-switch">
                    <button data-lang="en" class="active">EN</button>
                    <button data-lang="tr">TR</button>
                </div>
            </div>
            <h1 data-lang-en="Case Study: Bringing Battle Talent VR to Turkish Players" data-lang-tr="Vaka Çalışması: Battle Talent VR'ı Türk Oyuncularla Buluşturmak">Case Study: Bringing Battle Talent VR to Turkish Players</h1>
        </div>
    </header>

    <main class="case-study-content">
        <div class="container">
            <section class="project-overview">
                <h2 data-lang-en="Project Overview" data-lang-tr="Projeye Genel Bakış">Project Overview</h2>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Project:" data-lang-tr="Proje:">Project:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Turkish Localization of Battle Talent" data-lang-tr="Battle Talent Türkçe Yerelleştirmesi">Turkish Localization of Battle Talent</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Client:" data-lang-tr="Müşteri:">Client:</strong> CyDream Technologies Limited</li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Platform:" data-lang-tr="Platform:">Platform:</strong> Steam VR, Meta Quest</li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Timeline:" data-lang-tr="Zaman Çizelgesi:">Timeline:</strong> <span data-lang-en="January 2021 - Present (Ongoing)" data-lang-tr="Ocak 2021 - Halen (Devam Ediyor)">January 2021 - Present (Ongoing)</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Volume:" data-lang-tr="Hacim:">Volume:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Approx. 14,700 words / 86,000 characters (as of April 2025)" data-lang-tr="Yaklaşık 14.700 kelime / 86.000 karakter (Nisan 2025 itibarıyla)">Approx. 14,700 words / 86,000 characters (as of April 2025)</span></li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2 data-lang-en="Introduction" data-lang-tr="Giriş">Introduction</h2>
                <p data-lang-en="This case study details the ongoing Turkish localization project for Battle Talent, a physics-based VR rogue-lite action game developed by CyDream Technologies. Undertaken initially as a personal challenge while completing university studies in Translation & Interpretation, this project served as a crucial first step into the world of professional game localization, demanding adaptability, resourcefulness, and a long-term commitment." data-lang-tr="Bu vaka çalışması, CyDream Technologies tarafından geliştirilen fizik tabanlı VR rogue-lite aksiyon oyunu Battle Talent için devam eden Türkçe yerelleştirme projesini detaylandırmaktadır. Başlangıçta Mütercim-Tercümanlık alanındaki üniversite eğitimimi tamamlarken kişisel bir meydan okuma olarak üstlenilen bu proje, profesyonel oyun yerelleştirme dünyasına atılan kritik bir ilk adım olmuş, uyum sağlama, beceriklilik ve uzun vadeli bir bağlılık gerektirmiştir.">This case study details the ongoing Turkish localization project for Battle Talent, a physics-based VR rogue-lite action game developed by CyDream Technologies. Undertaken initially as a personal challenge while completing university studies in Translation & Interpretation, this project served as a crucial first step into the world of professional game localization, demanding adaptability, resourcefulness, and a long-term commitment.</p>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2 data-lang-en="The Challenge: Navigating Early Career Localization Hurdles" data-lang-tr="Zorluk: Kariyer Başlangıcındaki Yerelleştirme Engellerini Aşmak">The Challenge: Navigating Early Career Localization Hurdles</h2>
                <p data-lang-en="The primary objective was to proactively seek practical game localization experience, applying academic knowledge to a real-world project and demonstrating capability in the field. However, this ambition came with several significant hurdles:" data-lang-tr="Temel amaç, akademik bilgiyi gerçek dünya projesine uygulayarak ve alandaki yeteneği göstererek proaktif bir şekilde pratik oyun yerelleştirme deneyimi aramaktı. Ancak bu hedef, beraberinde birkaç önemli engel getirdi:">The primary objective was to proactively seek practical game localization experience, applying academic knowledge to a real-world project and demonstrating capability in the field. However, this ambition came with several significant hurdles:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Indirect Source Text:" data-lang-tr="Dolaylı Kaynak Metin:">Indirect Source Text:</strong> <span data-lang-en="The English text used as the source for Turkish translation was itself a non-professional translation from the original Simplified Chinese, introducing a layer of potential ambiguity and requiring careful interpretation." data-lang-tr="Türkçe çeviri için kaynak olarak kullanılan İngilizce metin, orijinal Basitleştirilmiş Çince'den profesyonel olmayan bir çeviriydi ve potansiyel bir belirsizlik katmanı oluşturarak dikkatli yorumlama gerektiriyordu.">The English text used as the source for Turkish translation was itself a non-professional translation from the original Simplified Chinese, introducing a layer of potential ambiguity and requiring careful interpretation.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Tooling & Workflow Constraints:" data-lang-tr="Araç ve İş Akışı Kısıtlamaları:">Tooling & Workflow Constraints:</strong> <span data-lang-en="The localization process relied entirely on a shared Google Sheet for all translators across different languages. This lacked the robust features of standard CAT tools, making terminology management and consistency tracking difficult, especially in the early stages." data-lang-tr="Yerelleştirme süreci, farklı dillerdeki tüm çevirmenler için tamamen paylaşılan bir Google E-Tablosuna dayanıyordu. Bu durum, standart CAT araçlarının güçlü özelliklerinden yoksundu ve özellikle ilk aşamalarda terminoloji yönetimi ile tutarlılık takibini zorlaştırıyordu.">The localization process relied entirely on a shared Google Sheet for all translators across different languages. This lacked the robust features of standard CAT tools, making terminology management and consistency tracking difficult, especially in the early stages.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Terminology & Consistency:" data-lang-tr="Terminoloji ve Tutarlılık:">Terminology & Consistency:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Establishing appropriate Turkish terminology for unique game concepts (e.g., weapon types like 'Rapier', spell names like 'Abyssal Faith Spell') was challenging due to the lack of established Turkish gaming glossaries or accessible translation memories. Ensuring consistency across the growing text volume (~14.7k words) within the Google Sheet environment required meticulous effort." data-lang-tr="Özgün oyun konseptleri (ör. 'Rapier' gibi silah türleri, 'Abyssal Faith Spell' gibi büyü adları) için uygun Türkçe terminolojiyi oluşturmak, yerleşik Türkçe oyun sözlüklerinin veya erişilebilir çeviri belleklerinin eksikliği nedeniyle zordu. Google E-Tablosu ortamında artan metin hacmi (~14.7 bin kelime) boyunca tutarlılığı sağlamak titiz bir çaba gerektiriyordu.">Establishing appropriate Turkish terminology for unique game concepts (e.g., weapon types like 'Rapier', spell names like 'Abyssal Faith Spell') was challenging due to the lack of established Turkish gaming glossaries or accessible translation memories. Ensuring consistency across the growing text volume (~14.7k words) within the Google Sheet environment required meticulous effort.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Limited Testing Environment:" data-lang-tr="Sınırlı Test Ortamı:">Limited Testing Environment:</strong> <span data-lang-en="No dedicated developer build was available for testing. Validating translations required waiting for monthly public game updates and then testing playthroughs within the live VR environment – a physically demanding and time-consuming process for a game with a relatively small Turkish player base, limiting feedback opportunities." data-lang-tr="Test için özel bir geliştirici sürümü mevcut değildi. Çevirileri doğrulamak, aylık halka açık oyun güncellemelerini beklemeyi ve ardından canlı VR ortamında test oyunları yapmayı gerektiriyordu – bu, nispeten küçük bir Türk oyuncu kitlesine sahip bir oyun için fiziksel olarak zorlayıcı ve zaman alıcı bir süreçti ve geri bildirim fırsatlarını sınırlıyordu.">No dedicated developer build was available for testing. Validating translations required waiting for monthly public game updates and then testing playthroughs within the live VR environment – a physically demanding and time-consuming process for a game with a relatively small Turkish player base, limiting feedback opportunities.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Lack of Formal Guidance:" data-lang-tr="Resmi Yönlendirme Eksikliği:">Lack of Formal Guidance:</strong> <span data-lang-en="While the developers were supportive, no formal style guide or glossary was provided initially, requiring proactive establishment of localization standards for Turkish." data-lang-tr="Geliştiriciler destekleyici olsa da, başlangıçta resmi bir stil kılavuzu veya sözlük sağlanmadı, bu da Türkçe için yerelleştirme standartlarının proaktif olarak oluşturulmasını gerektirdi.">While the developers were supportive, no formal style guide or glossary was provided initially, requiring proactive establishment of localization standards for Turkish.</span></li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2 data-lang-en="Process & Solution: Adaptability and Continuous Improvement" data-lang-tr="Süreç ve Çözüm: Uyum Sağlama ve Sürekli İyileştirme">Process & Solution: Adaptability and Continuous Improvement</h2>
                <p data-lang-en="Despite the constraints, a pragmatic and evolving workflow was established:" data-lang-tr="Kısıtlamalara rağmen, pragmatik ve gelişen bir iş akışı oluşturuldu:">Despite the constraints, a pragmatic and evolving workflow was established:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Research-Driven Translation:" data-lang-tr="Araştırma Odaklı Çeviri:">Research-Driven Translation:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Each term or string was approached with research, utilizing online dictionaries (Tureng.com), cross-referencing translations in other Turkish-localized games, and occasionally leveraging AI for obscure terms. Translations were entered directly into the shared Google Sheet." data-lang-tr="Her terim veya dizeye araştırma ile yaklaşıldı; çevrimiçi sözlükler (Tureng.com) kullanıldı, diğer Türkçe yerelleştirilmiş oyunlardaki çevirilerle karşılaştırmalar yapıldı ve nadiren belirsiz terimler için yapay zekadan yararlanıldı. Çeviriler doğrudan paylaşılan Google E-Tablosuna girildi.">Each term or string was approached with research, utilizing online dictionaries (Tureng.com), cross-referencing translations in other Turkish-localized games, and occasionally leveraging AI for obscure terms. Translations were entered directly into the shared Google Sheet.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Personal Glossary Development:" data-lang-tr="Kişisel Sözlük Geliştirme:">Personal Glossary Development:</strong> <span data-lang-en="A personal glossary was created and maintained to track key terms and ensure consistency, with plans to develop a dedicated terminology management app." data-lang-tr="Anahtar terimleri takip etmek ve tutarlılığı sağlamak için kişisel bir sözlük oluşturuldu ve sürdürüldü; özel bir terminoloji yönetimi uygulaması geliştirme planları yapıldı.">A personal glossary was created and maintained to track key terms and ensure consistency, with plans to develop a dedicated terminology management app.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Post-Update LQA:" data-lang-tr="Güncelleme Sonrası LQA:">Post-Update LQA:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Following each monthly game update, dedicated time was spent testing the newly added or modified Turkish strings within the VR game itself, identifying and correcting errors or awkward phrasing (post-editing)." data-lang-tr="Her aylık oyun güncellemesinin ardından, yeni eklenen veya değiştirilen Türkçe dizeleri VR oyununun içinde test etmek, hataları veya uygunsuz ifadeleri belirleyip düzeltmek (son düzenleme) için özel zaman ayrıldı.">Following each monthly game update, dedicated time was spent testing the newly added or modified Turkish strings within the VR game itself, identifying and correcting errors or awkward phrasing (post-editing).</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Leveraging AI for Consistency:" data-lang-tr="Tutarlılık İçin Yapay Zekadan Yararlanma:">Leveraging AI for Consistency:</strong> <span data-lang-en="To address the consistency challenges inherent in the spreadsheet-based workflow, a 'Hybrid Translation Methodology' was adopted as Large Language Models became more capable (specifically Gemini 2.5 Pro as of April 2025). The entire translation text was periodically fed into the AI, which helped identify potential inconsistencies (e.g., flagging similar source terms translated differently, variations in standard UI phrasing) that were difficult to spot manually in the spreadsheet format, allowing for targeted rectification." data-lang-tr="E-tablo tabanlı iş akışının doğasında bulunan tutarlılık zorluklarını ele almak için, Büyük Dil Modelleri daha yetenekli hale geldikçe (özellikle Nisan 2025 itibarıyla Gemini 2.5 Pro) bir 'Hibrit Çeviri Metodolojisi' benimsendi. Tüm çeviri metni periyodik olarak yapay zekaya verildi; bu, e-tablo formatında manuel olarak fark edilmesi zor olan potansiyel tutarsızlıkları (ör. farklı çevrilmiş benzer kaynak terimleri işaretleme, standart kullanıcı arayüzü ifadelerindeki varyasyonlar) belirlemeye yardımcı oldu ve hedeflenen düzeltmelere olanak sağladı.">To address the consistency challenges inherent in the spreadsheet-based workflow, a 'Hybrid Translation Methodology' was adopted as Large Language Models became more capable (specifically Gemini 2.5 Pro as of April 2025). The entire translation text was periodically fed into the AI, which helped identify potential inconsistencies (e.g., flagging similar source terms translated differently, variations in standard UI phrasing) that were difficult to spot manually in the spreadsheet format, allowing for targeted rectification.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Community & Developer Communication:" data-lang-tr="Topluluk ve Geliştirici İletişimi:">Community & Developer Communication:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Active participation in the dedicated translator Discord channel facilitated communication with other language translators and the development team for clarifications, bug reporting, and feedback." data-lang-tr="Özel çevirmen Discord kanalına aktif katılım, açıklamalar, hata raporlama ve geri bildirim için diğer dil çevirmenleri ve geliştirme ekibi ile iletişimi kolaylaştırdı.">Active participation in the dedicated translator Discord channel facilitated communication with other language translators and the development team for clarifications, bug reporting, and feedback.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Iterative Refinement:" data-lang-tr="Yinelemeli İyileştirme:">Iterative Refinement:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Recognizing the learning curve, older translations were revisited and updated over the years to reflect improved skills, better terminology choices, and a deeper understanding of localization best practices." data-lang-tr="Öğrenme eğrisinin farkında olarak, eski çeviriler yıllar içinde geliştirilmiş becerileri, daha iyi terminoloji seçimlerini ve yerelleştirme en iyi uygulamalarına dair daha derin bir anlayışı yansıtacak şekilde yeniden gözden geçirildi ve güncellendi.">Recognizing the learning curve, older translations were revisited and updated over the years to reflect improved skills, better terminology choices, and a deeper understanding of localization best practices.</span></li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2 data-lang-en="Results & Impact: Delivering Value and Fostering Growth" data-lang-tr="Sonuçlar ve Etki: Değer Sunma ve Gelişimi Destekleme">Results & Impact: Delivering Value and Fostering Growth</h2>
                <p data-lang-en="The ongoing localization effort has successfully made Battle Talent accessible to its Turkish-speaking audience and yielded significant personal development:" data-lang-tr="Devam eden yerelleştirme çabası, Battle Talent'ı Türkçe konuşan kitlesi için başarılı bir şekilde erişilebilir hale getirdi ve önemli kişisel gelişim sağladı:">The ongoing localization effort has successfully made Battle Talent accessible to its Turkish-speaking audience and yielded significant personal development:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Enhanced Accessibility for Turkish Players:" data-lang-tr="Türk Oyuncular İçin Geliştirilmiş Erişilebilirlik:">Enhanced Accessibility for Turkish Players:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Delivered and maintained a complete Turkish localization, making the VR experience fully accessible and enjoyable for the Turkish-speaking player base. Developer data indicated approximately 84 players were engaging with the game in or near Turkey. While direct feedback was scarce, 5 Steam reviews were posted in Turkish." data-lang-tr="Tam bir Türkçe yerelleştirme sunuldu ve sürdürüldü, bu da VR deneyimini Türkçe konuşan oyuncu kitlesi için tamamen erişilebilir ve keyifli hale getirdi. Geliştirici verileri, Türkiye'de veya yakınında yaklaşık 84 oyuncunun oyunla etkileşimde bulunduğunu gösterdi. Doğrudan geri bildirim az olsa da, Türkçe olarak 5 Steam incelemesi yayınlandı.">Delivered and maintained a complete Turkish localization, making the VR experience fully accessible and enjoyable for the Turkish-speaking player base. Developer data indicated approximately 84 players were engaging with the game in or near Turkey. While direct feedback was scarce, 5 Steam reviews were posted in Turkish.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Strong Developer Relationship:" data-lang-tr="Güçlü Geliştirici İlişkisi:">Strong Developer Relationship:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Trust was established and maintained with CyDream Technologies, who relied on this sole effort for the Turkish market. Communication remained open and positive via Discord." data-lang-tr="Türk pazarı için bu tek çabaya güvenen CyDream Technologies ile güven tesis edildi ve sürdürüldü. İletişim Discord üzerinden açık ve olumlu kaldı.">Trust was established and maintained with CyDream Technologies, who relied on this sole effort for the Turkish market. Communication remained open and positive via Discord.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Solidified Career Path:" data-lang-tr="Sağlamlaşan Kariyer Yolu:">Solidified Career Path:</strong> <span data-lang-en="The project confirmed a passion for game localization and highlighted the need for quality localization in the Turkish market, noting a lack of resources for aspiring localizers." data-lang-tr="Proje, oyun yerelleştirmeye olan tutkuyu doğruladı ve Türk pazarında kaliteli yerelleştirmeye olan ihtiyacı vurguladı; ayrıca hevesli yerelleştiriciler için kaynak eksikliğine dikkat çekti.">The project confirmed a passion for game localization and highlighted the need for quality localization in the Turkish market, noting a lack of resources for aspiring localizers.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Demonstrated Resilience & Adaptability:" data-lang-tr="Gösterilen Direnç ve Uyum Yeteneği:">Demonstrated Resilience & Adaptability:</strong> <span data-lang-en="Successfully navigating the project's constraints (indirect source text, basic tools, limited testing) showcased problem-solving skills and commitment." data-lang-tr="Projenin kısıtlamalarını (dolaylı kaynak metin, temel araçlar, sınırlı test) başarıyla aşmak, problem çözme becerilerini ve bağlılığı sergiledi.">Successfully navigating the project's constraints (indirect source text, basic tools, limited testing) showcased problem-solving skills and commitment.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Foundation for Future Projects:" data-lang-tr="Gelecek Projeler İçin Temel:">Foundation for Future Projects:</strong> <span data-lang-en="The experience gained provided the confidence and skillset to take on larger, more complex localization projects, such as Heroes of Hammerwatch II. It underscored the importance of devotion to long-term projects involving continuous updates." data-lang-tr="Kazanılan deneyim, Heroes of Hammerwatch II gibi daha büyük, daha karmaşık yerelleştirme projelerini üstlenmek için gereken güveni ve beceri setini sağladı. Sürekli güncellemeler içeren uzun vadeli projelere bağlılığın önemini vurguladı.">The experience gained provided the confidence and skillset to take on larger, more complex localization projects, such as Heroes of Hammerwatch II. It underscored the importance of devotion to long-term projects involving continuous updates.</span></li>
                    <li><strong data-lang-en="Skill Development:" data-lang-tr="Beceri Gelişimi:">Skill Development:</strong> <span data-lang-en="The project honed skills in technical translation, terminology management, LQA in VR, post-editing, cross-cultural communication (within the translation team), and integrating AI tools effectively into the workflow." data-lang-tr="Proje; teknik çeviri, terminoloji yönetimi, VR'da LQA, son düzenleme, kültürlerarası iletişim (çeviri ekibi içinde) ve yapay zeka araçlarını iş akışına etkili bir şekilde entegre etme becerilerini geliştirdi.">The project honed skills in technical translation, terminology management, LQA in VR, post-editing, cross-cultural communication (within the translation team), and integrating AI tools effectively into the workflow.</span></li>
                </ul>
            </section>

            <section>
                <h2 data-lang-en="Conclusion" data-lang-tr="Sonuç">Conclusion</h2>
                <p data-lang-en="The Battle Talent Turkish localization project stands as a testament to proactive learning and dedication. Overcoming initial challenges related to resources, tools, and testing methodology, this ongoing effort not only delivered a valuable localization for Turkish VR gamers but also provided an invaluable foundation, shaping a dedicated approach to game localization characterized by continuous improvement, adaptability, and a commitment to quality." data-lang-tr="Battle Talent Türkçe yerelleştirme projesi, proaktif öğrenme ve adanmışlığın bir kanıtıdır.             </section>
        </div>
    </main>

### [case-study.js](file:///c%3A/Users/alpya/Documents/GitHub/AlpWebsite/CaseStudyPage/case-study.js)

Add language switching logic, reading from localStorage.

````javascript
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
    console.log("Case study page loaded.");

    const langSwitchContainers = document.querySelectorAll('.lang-switch'); // Find all lang switch containers
    const translatableElements = document.querySelectorAll('[data-lang-en], [data-lang-tr]');
    const htmlTag = document.documentElement;
    const titleTag = document.querySelector('title');
    const descriptionTag = document.querySelector('meta[name="description"]');
    const floatingButton = document.getElementById('return-to-main');

    const setLanguage = (lang) => {
        if (lang !== 'en' && lang !== 'tr') lang = 'en'; // Default

        // Update text content more safely
        translatableElements.forEach(el => {
            const text = el.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}`);
            if (text !== null) {
                // Check if the element contains only text or specific allowed tags (like <i> or <strong>)
                const allowedTags = ['i', 'strong'];
                const hasNonAllowedChildren = Array.from(el.childNodes).some(node =>
                    node.nodeType === Node.ELEMENT_NODE && !allowedTags.includes(node.tagName.toLowerCase())
                );

                // Simple check for leading/trailing icons/strong tags within the data attribute itself
                const containsTagsInData = /<[a-z][\s\S]*>/i.test(text);

                if (containsTagsInData && !hasNonAllowedChildren) {
                     // If data attribute has HTML and element structure is simple, use innerHTML
                     el.innerHTML = text;
                } else if (!hasNonAllowedChildren && el.firstElementChild && allowedTags.includes(el.firstElementChild.tagName.toLowerCase())) {
                    // Handle case with leading icon/strong (like in back-link)
                    const firstChildHTML = el.firstElementChild.outerHTML;
                    // Use textContent for the rest to avoid parsing issues if data attribute contains HTML
                    const textContentOnly = text.replace(/<[a-z].*?>.*?<\/[a-z]>\s*/i, '').trim();
                    el.innerHTML = firstChildHTML + ' '; // Add space after element
                    // Append the text as a text node
                    el.appendChild(document.createTextNode(textContentOnly));
                }
                 else {
                    // For simple text or elements where we don't want to preserve complex inner HTML,
                    // set textContent directly.
                    el.textContent = text;
                }
            }
        });

        // Update HTML lang attribute
        htmlTag.setAttribute('lang', lang);

        // Update Title tag
        if (titleTag) {
             const titleText = titleTag.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}`);
             if (titleText) {
                document.title = titleText; // Update document title directly
             }
        }
        // Update Meta Description
        if (descriptionTag) {
            const descText = descriptionTag.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}`);
            if (descText) {
                descriptionTag.setAttribute('content', descText);
            }
        }

        // Update floating button aria-label and title
        if (floatingButton) {
            const ariaLabel = floatingButton.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}-aria-label`);
            const titleText = floatingButton.getAttribute(`data-lang-${lang}-title`);
            if (ariaLabel) floatingButton.setAttribute('aria-label', ariaLabel);
            if (titleText) floatingButton.setAttribute('title', titleText);
        }


        // Update button active states in all switchers
        langSwitchContainers.forEach(container => {
            container.querySelectorAll('button[data-lang]').forEach(btn => {
                if (btn.getAttribute('data-lang') === lang) {
                    btn.classList.add('active');
                } else {
                    btn.classList.remove('active');
                }
            });
        });

        // Store preference
        try {
            localStorage.setItem('preferredLanguage', lang);
        } catch (e) {
            console.warn("Could not save language preference to localStorage:", e);
        }
    };

    // Add event listeners to all language buttons
    langSwitchContainers.forEach(container => {
        container.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
            if (e.target.tagName === 'BUTTON' && e.target.hasAttribute('data-lang')) {
                const selectedLang = e.target.getAttribute('data-lang');
                setLanguage(selectedLang);
            }
        });
    });

    // --- Initial Language Setup ---
    let preferredLanguage = 'en'; // Default
    try {
        const storedLang = localStorage.getItem('preferredLanguage');
        if (storedLang === 'en' || storedLang === 'tr') {
            preferredLanguage = storedLang;
        }
    } catch (e) {
        console.warn("Could not read language preference from localStorage:", e);
    }

    // Apply the initial language
    setLanguage(preferredLanguage);

});
````
